means: 避开，避免，预防( avoid的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: We are learning how to confront death instead of avoiding its reality.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们在学习如何直面死亡，而非回避死亡这一现实。

sentence.Network_en: Expertly he zigzagged his way across the field, avoiding the deeper gullies.
sentence.Network_cn: 他熟练地左一拐右一拐地绕过深沟，穿过了原野。

sentence.Network_en: Avoiding mosquito bites is easier said than done.

PerfectNetExp.abs: they lived a very frugal existence , avoiding all luxuries .他们生活非常俭，力避奢华。

severe heart and high blood pressure conditions may mean avoiding standing forward bends altogether or bending only from the hips with a level spine so that the heart is never lower than the hips .有严重心脏病和高血压的症状的学生意味着他们要尽量避免站立并前弯体式同时进行，或者仅仅是向前弯到臀部线以上保持脊柱水平

severe heart and high blood pressure conditions may mean avoiding standing forward bends altogether or bending only from the hips with a level spine so that the heart is never lower than the hips .有严重心脏病和高血压的症状的学生意味着他们要尽量避免站立并前弯体式同时进行，或者仅仅是向前弯到臀部线以上保持脊柱水平
Prospectuses tend to solve the conundrum by avoiding mention of the party ' s role ., 公司的简章中避实就虚 , 因为难以解决这一难题 , 索性没有提及共产党的角色.

list.abs: 却字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 除;去〖 getridof〗 避;避免〖 avoid〗 固然〖 admittedly〗.
字典中畏字的解释 ... (7) 担心[ worry] (8) 避开[ avoid] (9) 憎恶;怨恨[ hate].
规避(Avoidance) 避免使用一个不熟悉的分包商，采用一种熟悉的、而不是创新的方法等等都是有效规避风险的例子。2。

entry.def: If you avoid something unpleasant that might happen, you take action in order to prevent it from happening.

example.ex: The pilots had to take emergency action to avoid a disaster...
example.tran: 飞行员不得不采取紧急措施避免灾难的发生。

example.ex: Women have to dress modestly, to avoid being harassed by the locals.
example.tran: 女士穿着应当庄重，以免受到当地人的骚扰。

entry.def: If you avoid doing something, you choose not to do it, or you put yourself in a situation where you do not have to do it.

example.ex: By borrowing from dozens of banks, he managed to avoid giving any of them an overall picture of what he was up to...
example.tran: 他向许多银行借款，使得任何一家都搞不清楚他到底要做什么。

example.ex: He was always careful to avoid embarrassment.
example.tran: 他总是小心谨慎地避免尴尬。

entry.def: If you avoid a person or thing, you keep away from them. When talking to someone, if you avoid the subject, you keep the conversation away from a particular topic.

example.ex: She eventually had to lock herself in the toilets to avoid him...
example.tran: 她最后只好把自己锁在厕所里来躲开他。

example.ex: All through lunch he had carefully avoided the subject of the house.
example.tran: 整个午饭期间，他一直在小心翼翼地回避房子的话题。

entry.def: If a person or vehicle avoids someone or something, they change the direction they are moving in, so that they do not hit them.

example.ex: The driver had ample time to brake or swerve and avoid the woman.
example.tran: 司机有足够的时间刹车或急转弯，来避开那个女人。

Sentence.sentence: the new findings do highlight the benefits of focusing on our food and avoiding TV and multitasking while eating.
Avoiding too much intervention in their children's education
Making ethical decisions is a critical part of avoiding future problems.

A recent article in The Harvard Crimson noted the shocking growth of Harvard's public relations arm in the last five years and it questioned whether a focus on risk management and avoiding controversy was really the best outward-looking face of this great institution.
Respect is shown by looking in the general direction but avoiding direct eye contact.
